alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 2:48AM EST until February 19 at 7:01PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Looking Glass River Near Eagle affecting Clinton County. .Heavy rain, combined with the melting snow has produced a significant amount of runoff this morning. This runoff is leading to a significant climb in the flow on the Looking Glass River near Eagle. For the Looking Glass River...including Eagle...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Looking Glass River Near Eagle. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes in Dewitt and along the Looking Glass River between Dewitt and Eagle. River levels flood warming hut, playground, and ball field in Looking Glass Valley Park in Wacousta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 7.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.7 feet on 04/05/1947. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon.
